item.title: Today I Learned
item.description: Whatever I end up learning on my day to day exploration. If it seem interesting to me I will share it as a post here.

item.title: Uses this
item.description: Hardware, services and tools I am using to get things done. Starting with my dream setup which I found on r/battlestations. I would like to have a similar setup in the coming years for me. Dream Setup My Current Setup looks something like this. Hardware MacBook Pro 16" Intel: Primary personal computer Lenovo IdeaPad: Work computer iPhone 13: Primary phone iPad Mini 5th generation Apple Watch SE AirPods Pro Apple Pencil 1st generation HomePod 1st generation Canon 700D DSLR Camera Software On Laptop Emacs: For coding and taking notes Org-mode and Org-roam: For making notes (Zettelkasten) Safari: My main browser Apple Pages: For anything related to document Apple Keynote: It’s the best software for making presentations Microsoft Excel: For anything related to data Microsoft VS Code: My other code editor Brave Browser: My occasional browser Craft: For saving everything on the go Things 3: For my project management Figma: For designing wallpapers Tweetbot: For browsing twitter Discord: For communities and their messages I never read Slack: For work Apple Music Xcode Apple Podcasts Photos iMessage Telegram On iPad Books Safari Netflix Onefootball On Phone Tweetbot: Twitter client app Apollo: For browsing Reddit Reeder: One of the best RSS app ever developed Github Social iMessage Telegram Signal WhatsApp LinkedIn: Every now and then Instagram: I have a Screen Time set for 20 minutes Apple Notes: For taking notes on the fly Craft: For saving any tweet/article that I might read later Things 3: For my project management Oak: My main meditation app Kite: For investing in Indian stock market Groww: To invest in Mutual Binance: To invest in crypto Apple Email: My personal email application Outlook: For my work email Apple Music Apple Podcasts

item.title: Bookshelf
item.description: This will be interesting to some people, who want to read some great books and don’t know where to start from. I will try to have these books in physical form and I’ll keep updating this list as I read more books. If you got recommendations, feel free to drop a note! The books I have read and I recommend you should too Currently reading Bad Blood, John Carreyrou Deep Learning with Python: 2nd edition, Fran√ßois Chollet A Brief History of Time A man called Ove The Creactive Act Biographies & Start-up Stories Steve Jobs, Walter Isaacson Johan Cryuff My Turn Jony Ive: The Genius Behind Apple’s Greatest Products, Leander Kahney Shoe Dog: A Memoir by the creator of Nike, Phil Knight Hatching twitter No filter: The inside story of Instagram Creativity Inc.

item.title: About
item.description: Hi, I am Ankit Sharma and I have been working in Machine Learning for almost ~3 years. I currently, work as an Software Engineer @Gramvaani. My interests range from reading non-fiction and sci-fi, study physics, machine learning and breaking and building on Apple platforms. Currently, I live in Noida, Uttar Pradesh but natively I am from Patna, Bihar. Public Profiles mastodon twitter stackoverflow linkedin hackernews reddit medium telegram instagram facebook

item.title: Now
item.description: What I am doing now? Work I am working as a Machine Learning Engineer in a startup, OnionDev Tech (Gramvaani). My work involves around writing Django Apps to training and deploying Machine Learning models. Previous project: To make a QnA System from unstructured data where a farmer can ask anything about his/her crops over an IVR system. Current project: Exploring climate conditions and effects of areas for growing crops using satellite images of places in UP and Bihar.

item.title: People
item.description: Internet people who write about a variety of topics. I have tried to make this list of people sorted based on their expertise in their respective fields. Startups, Products & Strategy Balaji Srinivasan | balajis Paul Graham | paulg Aaron Swartz Vitalik Buterin | vitalikbuterin Naval | naval Software Engineering John Siracusa | siracusa Joel Spolsky | spolsky Machine Learning Andrej Karpathy | blog | karpathy Greg Brockman | gdb Yann LeCun | ylecun
